definition: to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)
to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)

sentences.english: Why did you change my thing in my medicine bag?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼你掉換了我包裏的東西？

sentences.english: He replaced the worn type with a new one.
sentences.chinese: 他把那些磨損的輪胎替掉換上新的。

sentences.english: Products forming the subject of complaints shall be replaced in the vehicle by new parts.
sentences.chinese: 引起索賠的產品應用新的零部件在車輛中進行掉換。
